qas.question: The Lord Mayor's Show occurs annually in what month?
What does the Lord Mayor's Show parade commemorate and celebrate?

answers.text: the annual appointment of a new Lord Mayor

qas.question: Who participates in the military pageantry in the Trooping the Colour event every June?

answers.text: regiments of the Commonwealth and British armies

qas.question: Fireworks are discharged on New Year's Eve from what contemporary London landmark?
Every June, the Trooping of the Colour celebrates what event?

context: There is a variety of annual events, beginning with the relatively new New Year's Day Parade, fireworks display at <a3_0>the London Eye<a3_0/>, the world's second largest street party, the Notting Hill Carnival is held during the late August Bank Holiday each year. Traditional parades include <a0_0>November<a0_0/>'s Lord Mayor's Show, a centuries-old event celebrating <a1_0>the annual appointment of a new Lord Mayor<a1_0/> of the City of London with a procession along the streets of the City, and June's Trooping the Colour, a formal military pageant performed by <a2_0>regiments of the Commonwealth and British armies<a2_0/> to celebrate <a4_0>the Queen's Official Birthday<a4_0/>.
